Calculate all complexity metrics for all genes in SCHT object

Source: R/complexity_metrics.R
calculate_isoform_complexity_metrics.Rd

This function calculates a comprehensive set of metrics to quantify transcriptomic complexity at multiple levels: within cells, across cells, within cell types, and across cell types. It analyses isoform diversity, cell type specificity, and expression patterns to provide a multidimensional characterisation of transcriptomic complexity.

Usage

calculate_isoform_complexity_metrics(
  scht_obj,
  default_thresholds = list(intra_cellular_isoform_diversity = 0.6,
    inter_cellular_isoform_diversity = 0.6, intra_cell_type_heterogeneity = 0.4,
    inter_cell_type_specificity = 0.6, intra_cell_type_heterogeneity_variability = 0.5,
    inter_cell_type_difference_variability = 0.3, cell_type_coexpression_variability =
    0.4),
  data_driven_thresholds = TRUE,
  visualise = TRUE,
  batch_size = 500,
  min_samples = 20,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

scht_obj

Single-Cell Hierarchical Tensor object

default_thresholds

List of default thresholds for each metric (optional)

data_driven_thresholds

Whether to use data-driven threshold detection (default: TRUE)

visualise

Whether to create visualisations of threshold determination (default: TRUE)

batch_size

Number of genes to process at once (default: 500)

min_samples

Minimum number of samples required for reliable threshold modelling

verbose

Whether to print detailed progress messages

Value

A transcriptomic_complexity object (list) containing:

  • metrics: Data frame with complexity metrics and classifications for each gene

  • single_cell_type_genes: List of genes expressed only in specific cell types

  • thresholds: The thresholds used for classification

  • threshold_plots: Visualisations of threshold fitting for each metric

  • na_statistics: Statistics about NA value proportions for each metric

With performance attribute containing:

  • total_time_sec: Total processing time in seconds

  • memory_used_mb: Memory utilised in megabytes

Details

The function calculates seven core complexity metrics:

  1. Intra-cellular Isoform Diversity: Measures the tendency for cells to co-express multiple isoforms of a gene

  2. Inter-cellular Isoform Diversity: Measures the overall diversity of isoforms used across the entire cell population

  3. Intra-cell type Heterogeneity: Measures the cell-to-cell variation in isoform usage within each cell type

  4. Inter-cell type Specificity: Measures how differently a gene uses its isoforms across different cell types

  5. Intra-cell type Heterogeneity Variability: Measures whether certain cell types show particularly high cellular heterogeneity

  6. Inter-cell type Difference Variability: Measures whether certain cell type pairs show particularly significant differences in isoform usage patterns

  7. Cell-type-specific Co-expression Variability: Measures whether a gene employs different isoform co-expression patterns in different cell types

For each metric, a classification column is created to categorise genes based on statistically determined thresholds. This provides a comprehensive complexity profile for each gene across multiple dimensions.

Some metrics may contain NA values, which have specific biological meanings:

  • Inter-cell type metrics are NA for genes expressed in only one cell type

  • Heterogeneity metrics are NA for genes with insufficient cells per cell type

  • Diversity metrics are NA for genes with only a single expressed isoform These NA values are properly handled during threshold determination and classification.
